abstract: The Deal Professor examines the question of whether the sweeping financial regulatory bill will prevent bailouts and he concludes that the answer is quite nuanced and a bit uncertain.
snippet: The Deal Professor examines the question of whether the sweeping financial regulatory bill will prevent bailouts and he concludes that the answer is quite nuanced and a bit uncertain.
lead_paragraph: The passage of the sweeping financial regulatory bill is imminent and the question that many are asking is whether it will prevent future banking bailouts. There are conflicting views. The sponsors vow that it will, and former Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. told DealBook’s Andrew Ross Sorkin that had the bill been in effect in the fall of 2008, he would have been able to take over Lehman Brothers and the American International Group without the financial system crumbling.
